PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_CableSegmentTypeConductorSegment
PropertySetDef.Definition: Definition from IAI: An electrical conductor is a single linear element with the specific purpose to lead electric current. The core of one lead is normally single wired or multiwired which are intertwined.

PropertyDef.Name: CrossSectionalArea
PropertyDef.Definition: Cross section area of the phase(s) lead(s)

PropertyDef.Name: NominalLength
PropertyDef.Definition: The nominal length of a conductor.

PropertyDef.Name: ElectricalConductorFunction
PropertyDef.Definition: Type of function for which the conductor is intended.

PropertyDef.Name: PhaseReference
PropertyDef.Definition: The phase identification used when the function of the conductor is a phase. In general, it is recommended that IEC recommendations for phase identification are used (L1, L2 etc.). However, other phase identifiers may be used such as by color (Red, Blue, Yellow) or by number (1, 2, 3) etc.

PropertyDef.Name: ConductorMaterial
PropertyDef.Definition: Type of material from which the conductor is constructed. Such as Aluminium or Copper

PropertyDef.Name: ConductorSheathMaterial
PropertyDef.Definition: The material from which the sheath or insulation is constructed. Such as EPR, Copper, MICC, PVC, PEX, Rubber, XPLE, XPLE_LS. Note that materials used should be agreed between exchange participants before use.

PropertyDef.Name: MaximumOperatingTemperature
PropertyDef.Definition: The maximum temperature at which the sheath retains its integrity.

PropertyDef.Name: IsFireResistant
PropertyDef.Definition: Indication of whether the sheath is fire resistant (= TRUE) or not (= FALSE).
